Regarding your Omega Seamaster watch, I can suggest that you contact Omega's official customer service or authorized dealers in your area to inquire about servicing and restoration options. They can provide you with a list of recommended watchmakers or service centers that are authorized to work on Omega watches.

Additionally, you can also search online for reputable and independent watchmakers in your area who specialize in vintage Omega watches. Look for reviews, testimonials, and certifications from organizations like the Watchmakers of Switzerland Training and Educational Program (WOSTEP) or the American Watchmakers-Clockmakers Institute (AWCI).

When selecting a watchmaker, make sure to ask questions about their experience with vintage Omega watches, their process for servicing and restoring watches, and the materials and parts they use. It's essential to work with a reputable and skilled watchmaker to ensure that your watch is restored to its original condition and retains its value.

Remember to always prioritize caution and do your research when selecting a watchmaker or dealer to work with. If you have any further questions or concerns, feel free to ask!
